alert.note: Alert for Coal; Hughes (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 2:59PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coal and south central Hughes Counties through 330 PM CST... At 259 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clarita, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tupelo, Bromide, Centrahoma, Olney and Clarita. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
